thread.title: Man Utd transfer news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic provides update on his Old Trafford future | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd transfer news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic provides update on his Old Trafford future | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd transfer news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic provides update on his Old Trafford future | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 11:16 pm Zlatan Ibrahimovic has enjoyed a superb season for Manchester United (Picture: Getty) 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic insists he is yet to decide whether to stay at Manchester United for another season. 
The Swedish superstar signed a 12-month deal with the Red Devils last summer but Jose Mourinho hopes to secure his services for another campaign. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
Ibrahimovic has impressed for United, scoring 20 goals in 34 games, and when asked about his future at the club, said: ‘Nothing is done.’ 
It is understood that the experienced striker has a clause in his contract that can be triggered if he reaches a certain amount of goals. 
‘Sometimes like that, I have to score 100 goals,’ Ibrahimovic joked when pressed about his contract situation. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (H) Thu 16 Feb Blackburn – FA Cup (A) – Sat 18 Feb St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar 
‘The option is already fulfilled. But there’s nothing done yet. From my side? We’ll wait and see – let’s see what happens.’
